intro: Buchnera henriquesii, commonly known as the Henriques' buchnera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical or subtropical habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
